result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane K Halverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Provide DNA sample if one has not been taken already

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 52 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The defendant is to remain in custody of the jail until a bed becomes available at a treatment facility (Exodus House)
.

supervisions.notes: First 7 months without release remaining to be served on EM through JSS w/random testing. JSS requirements:   Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, comply by any treatment recommendations & evals deemed appropriate by JSS. Credit to in custody portion. Financials converted to Civil Judgment.

JS Sentence Violation - ORDER TO DETAIN SIGNED BY SLH
VISIONS 7-14-16
From: Def Re: relapse

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
SLH: note & file

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
SLH: note & file

Request for Modification or Change in Sentence filed Def: req sentence to be changed to 6 1/2 months in custody & then be released to JSS to register for classes
SLH: approved

for Sentence Modification  to be released in 6 months instead of 7 mos to allow def to start classes in May
Per SLH:  He is to be released 4-22-16.  Program is early May;  not showing that early release is necessary

Request for Modification or Change in Sentence filed
SLH: denied - I would like to oblige but Mr Halverson was in control of the situation
Judgment - unable to fwd
revoked
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed

2:33 PM - Def in court w/ Atty Nikki C Swayne.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HYNEK: DOC recommends 10-12 mos. I don't know if that will meet his trmt needs. He's never had approp AODA trmt.  111 days credit. SWAYNE:  I have 112. Prison doesn't help w/ sub abuse issues. 8 mos CJ concurrent w/ Tremp Cty case. He's struggled w/ sub abuse issued. His meds are now regulated and I don't think we will see him violate again. He has a new child. DEF: I want to be the type of dad my kids can look up to.  CRT: 3 goals of sentencing is character/rehab needs/protection of the public.  You have a consistent crim hx. In the absence of more serious convictions and the nature of the hx presented in the rev paperwork I can't justify a prison term today but a sig period of incarceration is warranted. 
SENTENCE: def sentenced to  12 mos  CJ  w/ credit for  112 days concurrent w/ the Trempealeau Cty sentence. First 7 mos w/o release and the remaining to be served on EM thru JSS. Random testing;   Part of your JSS requirements are  not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician. Comply w/ any trmt recommendations made and any evals deemed warranted by JSS. credit to the in custody portion and good time proportionately. Convert financials to civil judgment
